Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: @ComputerGenie 游놊游낖游닉 i don't fully understand, but it's a turing complete language (almost reminds me of Brainfuck) where almost any random bits are valid code to execute. So an ASIC will have a very hard time being cheap to produce and efficient, since each random bitstring is a different valid program. Something like that

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: it's being developed by XMR/CryptoNote people, they really dislike ASICs

Author: dukeleto#7326
Content: there is no fixed algorithm to make crazy fast in hardware, I think is what they are trying to utilize
